name: FSlateFontInfo
doc: A representation of a font in Slate.

FontObject: The font object (valid when used from UMG or a Slate widget style asset)
FontMaterial: The material to use when rendering
OutlineSettings: Settings for applying an outline to a font
TypefaceFontName: The name of the font to use from the default typeface (None will use the first entry)
Size:
The font size is a measure in point values. The conversion of points to Slate Units is done at 96 DPI.
So if you're using a tool like Photoshop to prototype layouts and UI mock ups, you can change the UMG Font settings
to ensure that UMG font size is displayed in its 72 DPI equivalent, even if Slate will still use 96 DPI internally.
LetterSpacing: The uniform spacing (or tracking) between all characters in the text.
SkewAmount: A skew amount to apply to the text.
MonospacedWidth: The uniform width to apply to all characters when bForceMonospaced is enabled, proportional of the font Size.
